required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mindful Movement for Physical Activity and Wellbeing in Older Adults- A Hybrid Effectiveness-Implementation Study
clinical_study.official_title: Mindful Movement for Physical Activity and Wellbeing in Older Adults- A Community Based Randomized Hybrid Effectiveness-Implementation Study

collaborator.agency: National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health (NCCIH)

brief_summary.textblock: Physical inactivity has reached pandemic proportions and is associated with increased morbidity, mortality, and healthcare costs. Of particular concern is that most middle to older age adults fall far short of recommendations for health enhancing physical activities. This research takes a novel approach to tackling this problem by combining mindfulness with behavioral strategies in a unique 'Mindful Movement' program offered through YMCA community facilities.

primary_outcome.description: Minutes/week spent in ≥10-min bouts of MVPA

secondary_outcome.description: Steps per day will be measured.
Minutes/week spent in ≥10-min bouts of MVPA

The EQ5D captures five dimensions of health (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression) over 5 levels (no problem, slight problem, moderate problem, severe problem, unable to perform/extreme problem).

secondary_outcome.measure: Exercise Self-Efficacy- Self-Efficacy for Exercise (SEE) scale
secondary_outcome.description: Individuals are asked to rate their confidence in their ability to exercise. Confidence ratings range from 0 (not confident) to 10 (very confident).

secondary_outcome.measure: Exercise Expectations-Outcome Expectations for Exercise-2 (OEE-2) scale
secondary_outcome.description: This is a 13-item instrument focused on beliefs about the positive and negative physical and mental health benefits of exercise. Responses range from 1 (strongly agree) to 5 (strongly disagree).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mindfulness- Mindful Attention Awareness Scale (MAAS), Frieberg Mindfulness Inventory (FMI)
secondary_outcome.description: The MAAS scale is comprised of 15 items measured on a 6-point scale (1=almost always, 6=almost never). The FMI addresses 14 items with a four-point response scale (1=rarely, 4=almost always).

This 8 item scale assesses perceived success in relationships, self-esteem, and purpose. Responses are 7=Strongly Agree to 1=Strongly Disagree. Total score ranges from 8 to 56 (highest level of wellbeing or flourishing).
An 11-box numerical rating scale (0=no pain, 10=the worst pain possible) will be used for spinal pain, and upper and lower extremities.
This includes two, eight-item questionnaires with a six-item scale (1=strongly agree, 6=strongly disagree). Higher summed score indicates more social connectedness, assurance.

An adapted, nine-item instrument addressing days/week and minutes/day spent on physical activity in the past 7 days is used to measure physical activity. Reported as continuous variables days/week, minutes/day.
Participants will rate their overall satisfaction on 7 point scale (7=completely satisfied, 1= completely dissatisfied) with the intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Qualitative Assessment of Barriers to Intervention
secondary_outcome.description: This qualitative, open ended assessment explores dislikes and barriers to participation in the intervention.Themes will be categorized and described in percentages of participants reporting.

secondary_outcome.measure: Qualitative Assessment of Facilitators to Intervention
secondary_outcome.description: This qualitative, open ended assessment explores likes and facilitators to participation in the intervention. Themes will be categorized and described in percentages of participants reporting.

intervention.description: The program focuses on enhancing individuals' mindfulness capabilities and skills, specifically attention regulation, body awareness, emotional regulation, and shifts in self-perception, by providing opportunities for education, practice, and social suppo

This community-based educational program provides participants useful content focused on general health related topics including common chronic conditions, social support, social participation, cancer screening, immunization and keeping active.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
≥ 50 years of age
- Accelerometer wear time ≥10 hours on at least 4 days in a 7 consecutive day period between baselines
- Self-report of <140 minutes of MVPA per week in 3 months prior to baseline AND accelerometer recorded <100 minutes of MVPA between baselines
- Mini-Mental State score ≥ 24
- Independent self-ambulation
- Provides consent and is willing to participate in data collection activities
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Unwilling or unable to participate in study activities
- Current or upcoming participation in educational programs similar to those under study
- Medical restrictions to increasing Moderate Vigorous Physical Activity (MVPA)
- Terminal illness
- Contraindications to mindfulness practice

investigator.last_name: Roni L Evans, PhD, DC, MS
